# Authentication

* API Key (APIToken)
    - Parameter Name: **Authorization**, in: header. API key value must be prefixed with \"Token \".

- HTTP Authentication, scheme: bearer

`GET /groups/{group_id}/audit_logs/search`

*Search Group audit logs.*

Search audit logs for a Group. Some Organization level events are supported as well as the following
Group level events:
  - api.access
  - group.cloud_config.settings.edit
  - group.create
  - group.delete
  - group.edit
  - group.notification_settings.edit
  - group.org.add
  - group.org.remove
  - group.policy.create
  - group.policy.delete
  - group.policy.edit
  - group.request_access_settings.edit
  - group.role.create
  - group.role.delete
  - group.role.edit
  - group.service_account.create
  - group.service_account.delete
  - group.service_account.edit
  - group.settings.edit
  - group.settings.feature_flag.edit
  - group.sso.add
  - group.sso.auth0_connection.create
  - group.sso.auth0_connection.edit
  - group.sso.create
  - group.sso.delete
  - group.sso.edit
  - group.sso.membership.sync
  - group.sso.remove
  - group.tag.create
  - group.tag.delete
  - group.user.add
  - group.user.remove
  - group.user.role.edit

<h3 id="listgroupauditlogs-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|group_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the Group.|
|cursor|query|string|false|The ID for the next page of results.|
|from|query|string(date)|false|The start date (inclusive) of the audit logs search. Example: 2023-07-27|
|to|query|string(date)|false|The end date (inclusive) of the audit logs search. Example: 2023-07-27|
|size|query|integer(int32)|false|Number of results to return per page.|
|sort_order|query|string|false|Order in which results are returned.|
|user_id|query|string(uuid)|false|Filter logs by user ID.|
|project_id|query|string(uuid)|false|Filter logs by project ID.|
|event|query|string|false|Filter logs by event type, cannot be used in conjunction with exclude_event parameter.|
|exclude_event|query|string|false|Exclude event type from results, cannot be used in conjunctions with event parameter.|

#### Detailed descriptions

**from**: The start date (inclusive) of the audit logs search. Example: 2023-07-27

**to**: The end date (inclusive) of the audit logs search. Example: 2023-07-27

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|sort_order|ASC|
|sort_order|DESC|

*Create New Environment*

```json
}
```

*Update Environment*

Update an environment

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "options": {
        "role_arn": "arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/SnykCloud1234"
      }
    },
    "type": "environment"
  }
}
```

|body|body|object|false|none|
|» data|body|object|true|none|

`POST /orgs/{org_id}/cloud/scans`

*Create Scan*

<h1 id="snyk-api-custom-base-images">Custom Base Images</h1>

Through the Custom Base Image Recommendation feature, Snyk can recommend an image upgrade from a pool of the your internal images. 
This allows your teams to be notified of newer and more secure versions of internal base images.

`GET /custom_base_images`

*Get a custom base image collection*

Get a list of custom base images with support for ordering and filtering.
Either the org_id or group_id parameters must be set to authorize successfully.
If sorting by version, the repository filter is required.

<h3 id="getcustombaseimages-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|starting_after|query|string|false|Return the page of results immediately after this cursor|
|ending_before|query|string|false|Return the page of results immediately before this cursor|
|limit|query|integer(int32)|false|Number of results to return per page|
|project_id|query|string(uuid)|false|Filter environments by project ID|
|org_id|query|string(uuid)|false|The organization ID of the custom base image|
|group_id|query|string(uuid)|false|The group ID of the custom base image|
|repository|query|string|false|The image repository|
|tag|query|string|false|The image tag|
|include_in_recommendations|query|boolean|false|Whether this image should be recommended as a base image upgrade|
|sort_by|query|string|false|Which column to sort by. |
|sort_direction|query|string|false|Which direction to sort|

#### Detailed descriptions

**sort_by**: Which column to sort by. 
If sorting by version, the versioning schema is used.

`POST /custom_base_images`

*Create a Custom Base Image from an existing container project*

In order to create a custom base image, you first need to import your base images into Snyk.
You can do this through the CLI, UI, or API.

This endpoint marks an image as a custom base image. This means that the image will get
added to the pool of images from which Snyk can recommend base image upgrades.

Note, after the first image in a repository gets added, a versioning schema cannot be passed in this endpoint.
To update the versioning schema, the PATCH endpoint must be used.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "include_in_recommendations": true,
      "project_id": "2cab3939-d112-4ef0-836d-e09c87cbe69b",
      "versioning_schema": {
        "type": "semver"
      }
    },
    "type": "custom_base_image"
  }
}
```

|body|body|[CustomBaseImagePostRequest](#schemacustombaseimagepostrequest)|false|The properties used in the creation of a custom base image|

`POST /orgs/{org_id}/packages/issues`

*List issues for a given set of packages  (Currently not available to all customers)*

This endpoint is not available to all customers. If you are interested please contact support. Query issues for a batch of packages identified by Package URL (purl). Only direct vulnerabilities are returned, transitive vulnerabilities (from dependencies) are not returned because they can vary depending on context.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "purls": [
        "string"
      ]
    },
    "type": "resource"
  }
}
```

`GET /orgs/{org_id}/packages/{purl}/issues`

*List issues for a package*

Query issues for a specific package version identified by Package URL (purl). Snyk returns only direct vulnerabilities. Transitive vulnerabilities (from dependencies) are not returned because they can vary depending on context.

<h3 id="fetchissuesperpurl-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|purl|path|string|true|A URI-encoded Package URL (purl). Supported purl types are apk, cargo, cocoapods, composer, deb, gem, generic, golang, hex, maven, npm, nuget, pypi, rpm, and swift. A version for the package is also required.|
|org_id|path|string(uuid)|true|Unique identifier for an organization|
|offset|query|number|false|Specify the number of results to skip before returning results. Must be greater than or equal to 0. Default is 0.|
|limit|query|number|false|Specify the number of results to return. Must be greater than 0 and less than 1000. Default is 1000.|

`GET /orgs`

*List accessible organizations*

Get a paginated list of organizations you have access to.

<h3 id="listorgs-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|starting_after|query|string|false|Return the page of results immediately after this cursor|
|ending_before|query|string|false|Return the page of results immediately before this cursor|
|limit|query|integer(int32)|false|Number of results to return per page|
|group_id|query|string(uuid)|false|If set, only return organizations within the specified group|

`GET /orgs/{org_id}/projects/{project_id}/sbom`

*Get a project’s SBOM document*

This endpoint lets you retrieve the SBOM document of a software project.
It supports the following formats:
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+xml`).
* SPDX version 2.3 in JSON (set `format` to `spdx2.3+json`).

By default it will respond with an empty JSON:API response.

<h3 id="getsbom-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|org_id|path|string(uuid)|true|Unique identifier for an organization|
|project_id|path|string(uuid)|true|Unique identifier for a project|
|format|query|string|false|The desired SBOM format of the response.|

#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|format|cyclonedx1.4+json|
|format|cyclonedx1.4+xml|
|format|spdx2.3+json|

<h1 id="snyk-api-serviceaccounts">ServiceAccounts</h1>

Service accounts can be used for continuous integration (CI) and other automation purposes, without using an actual Snyk user’s token.

`GET /groups/{group_id}/service_accounts`

*Get a list of group service accounts.*

Get all service accounts for a group.

`POST /groups/{group_id}/service_accounts`

*Create a service account for a group.*

Create a service account for a group. The service account can be used to generate access tokens. Currently, we only allow group service accounts using default group roles.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "access_token_ttl_seconds": 3600,
      "auth_type": "api_key",
      "jwks_url": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "role_id": "ac4e70c8-d5be-48af-93eb-760f58fc91a9"
    },
    "type": "service_account"
  }
}
```

<h3 id="creategroupserviceaccount-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|group_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the Snyk Group that is creating and owns the service account|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|body|body|object|true|none|
|» data|body|object|true|none|
|»» attributes|body|object|true|none|
|»»» access_token_ttl_seconds|body|number|false|The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.|
|»»» auth_type|body|string|true|Authentication strategy for the service account:|
|»»» jwks_url|body|string|false|A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.|
|»»» name|body|string|true|A human-friendly name for the service account.|
|»»» role_id|body|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the role which the created service account should use.|
|»» type|body|string|true|The Resource type.|

#### Detailed descriptions

**»»» auth_type**: Authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|»»» auth_type|api_key|
|»»» auth_type|oauth_client_secret|
|»»» auth_type|oauth_private_key_jwt|
|»» type|service_account|

`PATCH /groups/{group_id}/service_accounts/{serviceaccount_id}`

*Update a group service account.*

Update the name of a group's service account by its ID.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "name": "string"
    },
    "id": "497f6eca-6276-4993-bfeb-53cbbbba6f08",
    "type": "service_account"
  }
}
```

`POST /groups/{group_id}/service_accounts/{serviceaccount_id}/secrets`

*Manage a group service account's client secret.*

Manage the client secret of a group service account by the service account ID.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "mode": "replace",
      "secret": "string"
    },
    "type": "service_account"
  }
}
```

<h3 id="updateserviceaccountsecret-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|group_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the Snyk Group that owns the service account.|
|serviceaccount_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the service account.|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|body|body|object|true|none|
|» data|body|object|true|none|
|»» attributes|body|object|true|none|
|»»» mode|body|string|true|Operation to perform:|
|»»» secret|body|string|false|Secret to delete when using `delete` mode|
|»» type|body|string|true|The Resource type.|

#### Detailed descriptions

**»»» mode**: Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated secret.
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets. A maximum of to two secrets can exist at a time.
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value. At least one secret must remain per service account.

#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|»»» mode|replace|
|»»» mode|create|
|»»» mode|delete|
|»» type|service_account|

`POST /orgs/{org_id}/service_accounts`

*Create a service account for an organization.*

Create a service account for an organization. The service account can be used to generate access tokens.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "access_token_ttl_seconds": 3600,
      "auth_type": "api_key",
      "jwks_url": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "role_id": "ac4e70c8-d5be-48af-93eb-760f58fc91a9"
    },
    "type": "service_account"
  }
}
```

<h3 id="createorgserviceaccount-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|org_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the Snyk Organization that is creating and will own the service account.|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|body|body|object|true|none|
|» data|body|object|true|none|
|»» attributes|body|object|true|none|
|»»» access_token_ttl_seconds|body|number|false|The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.|
|»»» auth_type|body|string|true|Authentication strategy for the service account:|
|»»» jwks_url|body|string|false|A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.|
|»»» name|body|string|true|A human-friendly name for the service account.|
|»»» role_id|body|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the role which the created service account should use. Obtained in the Snyk UI, via "Group Page" -> "Settings" -> "Member Roles" -> "Create new Role". Can be shared among multiple accounts.|
|»» type|body|string|false|The Resource type.|

#### Detailed descriptions

**»»» auth_type**: Authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Snyk API Key.
  * oauth_client_secret - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, which returns a client secret that can be used to retrieve an access token.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|»»» auth_type|api_key|
|»»» auth_type|oauth_client_secret|
|»»» auth_type|oauth_private_key_jwt|
|»» type|service_account|

`POST /orgs/{org_id}/service_accounts/{serviceaccount_id}/secrets`

*Manage an organization service account's client secret.*

Manage the client secret of an organization-level service account by the service account ID.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "mode": "replace",
      "secret": "string"
    },
    "type": "service_account"
  }
}
```

<h3 id="updateorgserviceaccountsecret-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|org_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the Snyk Organization that owns the service account.|
|serviceaccount_id|path|string(uuid)|true|The ID of the service account.|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|body|body|object|true|none|
|» data|body|object|true|none|
|»» attributes|body|object|true|none|
|»»» mode|body|string|true|Operation to perform:|
|»»» secret|body|string|false|Secret to delete when using `delete` mode|
|»» type|body|string|true|The Resource type.|

#### Detailed descriptions

**»»» mode**: Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated secret.
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets. A maximum of to two secrets can exist at a time.
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value. At least one secret must remain per service account.

#### Enumerated Values

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|»»» mode|replace|
|»»» mode|create|
|»»» mode|delete|
|»» type|service_account|

`GET /orgs/{org_id}/slack_app/{tenant_id}/channels`

*Get a list of Slack channels*

Requires the Snyk Slack App to be set up for this org, will retrieve a list of channels the Snyk Slack App can access. Note that it is currently only possible to page forwards through this collection, no prev links will be generated and the ending_before parameter will not function.

<h3 id="listchannels-parameters">Parameters</h3>

|Name|In|Type|Required|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|starting_after|query|string|false|Return the page of results immediately after this cursor|
|ending_before|query|string|false|Return the page of results immediately before this cursor|
|limit|query|integer(int32)|false|Number of results to return per page|
|version|query|[QueryVersion](#schemaqueryversion)|true|The requested version of the endpoint to process the request|
|org_id|path|string(uuid)|true|Org ID|
|tenant_id|path|string(uuid)|true|Tenant ID|

`POST /orgs/{org_id}/slack_app/{bot_id}/projects/{project_id}`

*Create a new Slack settings override for a given project.*

Create Slack settings override for a project.

```json
      "severity_threshold": "high",

  }
}
```

Get a list of an organization's targets.

`PATCH /groups/{group_id}/users/{id}`

*Update a user's role in a group*

Update a user's membership of the group. 

To remove a user's membership, provide 'null' as the membership parameter (see example).

At present, only removing memberships is supported by this endpoint. To update a user's group membership, please use
the UI or legacy API.

> Body parameter

```json
{
  "data": {
    "attributes": {
      "membership": {
        "role": "MEMBER"
      }
    },
    "id": "55a348e2-c3ad-4bbc-b40e-9b232d1f4121",
    "type": "user"
  }
}
```

<h2 id="tocS_VersioningSchema">VersioningSchema</h2>
<!-- backwards compatibility -->
<a id="schemaversioningschema"></a>
<a id="schema_VersioningSchema"></a>
<a id="tocSversioningschema"></a>
<a id="tocsversioningschema"></a>

```json
{
  "type": "semver"
}

```

The versioning scheme used by images in the repository.

A versioning schema is a system for identifying and organizing different versions of a project. 
It is used to track changes and updates to the project over time, and to help users identify which version they are using. 
A versioning schema typically consists of a series of numbers or labels that are incremented to reflect the progression of versions. 
For example, a versioning schema might use a series of numbers, such as "1.0", "1.1", "2.0", and so on, to indicate major and minor releases of a product. 
A consistent and well-defined versioning schema helps users and tools understand and track the development of a project.

|*anonymous*|[VersioningSchemaCustomType](#schemaversioningschemacustomtype)|false|none|The Custom Schema type is a way for Snyk to understand your company’s container image tag versioning scheme,<br>enabling Snyk to give more accurate base image upgrade recommendations.<br><br>This schema type is essentially a regular expression that groups the different parts of an image’s tag into comparable sections.<br><br>If your container image's tags follow a versioning scheme other than Semantic Versioning (SemVer), <br>it is highly recommended that you select the "Custom Versioning" schema for your image repositories.|

<h2 id="tocS_VersioningSchemaCustomType">VersioningSchemaCustomType</h2>
<!-- backwards compatibility -->
<a id="schemaversioningschemacustomtype"></a>
<a id="schema_VersioningSchemaCustomType"></a>
<a id="tocSversioningschemacustomtype"></a>
<a id="tocsversioningschemacustomtype"></a>

```json
{
  "expression": "(?<C0>.)\\-(?<M2>.*)",
  "label": "calendar with flavor schema",
  "type": "custom"
}

```

The Custom Schema type is a way for Snyk to understand your company’s container image tag versioning scheme,
enabling Snyk to give more accurate base image upgrade recommendations.

This schema type is essentially a regular expression that groups the different parts of an image’s tag into comparable sections.

If your container image's tags follow a versioning scheme other than Semantic Versioning (SemVer), 
it is highly recommended that you select the "Custom Versioning" schema for your image repositories.

### Properties

|Name|Type|Required|Restrictions|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|expression|string|true|none|The regular expression used to describe the format of tags.<br>Keep in mind that backslashes in the expression need to be escaped due to being encompassed in a JSON string.|
|label|string|false|none|A customizable string that can be set for a custom versioning schema to describe its meaning.<br>This label has no function.|
|type|string|true|none|none|

#### Enumerated Values

|Property|Value|
|---|---|
|type|custom|

<h2 id="tocS_VersioningSchemaDateType">VersioningSchemaDateType</h2>

<a id="tocsversioningschemadatetype"></a>

```json
{
  "type": "date"
}

```

The date versioning type is a versioning method that orders images by
the timestamp of when an image was marked as a CBI.

Snyk highly recommends you avoid this versioning method as there is no way fix any mistakes
without deleting and reimporting all of the images. Please consider Single Selection Versioning Schema instead.

|---|---|---|---|---|
|type|string|true|none|none|

|---|---|
|type|date|

<h2 id="tocS_VersioningSchemaSingleSelectionType">VersioningSchemaSingleSelectionType</h2>
<!-- backwards compatibility -->
<a id="schemaversioningschemasingleselectiontype"></a>
<a id="schema_VersioningSchemaSingleSelectionType"></a>
<a id="tocSversioningschemasingleselectiontype"></a>
<a id="tocsversioningschemasingleselectiontype"></a>

```json
{
  "is_selected": true,
  "type": "single-selection"
}

```

The Single Selection Versioning Schema allows manual setting of which image should be given as a recommendation.

Only one image can be set as the current recommendation. If no images are set as the current selection, 
no recommendation will be given.

It is recommended to use this versioning schema if your repository's tags aren't supported by the other schemas.

### Properties

|Name|Type|Required|Restrictions|Description|
|---|---|---|---|---|
|is_selected|boolean|true|none|Whether this image should be the recommendation. Only one image can be selected at a given time. Setting this<br>as true will remove previous selection.|
|type|string|true|none|none|

#### Enumerated Values

|Property|Value|
|---|---|
|type|single-selection|
